name: Scott Asling
comment: the gyms is quite good but it’s far too busy all the time, equipment regularly breaks and takes a long time to fix, and the ceilings are often leaking leading to mould on the walls. the cleaning is also terrible. i saw the same rubbish under the free weights for several days. i think that for profiting this gym has too many members. also with the day pass members this worsens the situation. it’s not really enjoyable and is quite unfair on members. over the years i have endured being a member there are cockroaches, dirt and dust, broken machines, dangerously ceilings, mould and leaks. photos attached. i hope that altafit can focus on paying customer satisfaction by signing up only a fair number of members to the club, restricting guests and making sure the safety and equipment of the club is satisfactory. worth noting that the desk staff are very friendly; no complaints there.

name: YAFEA ALYAFEI
comment: i was looking for a gym during my stay in madrid. and this was my best option. the location is perfect. it was just 2 minutes walking distance from my hotel. the place is huge and they have a day pass, which is perfect for someone like me as a visitor. the price was great and the staff were nice and friendly. i highly recommend it. it's located in sol.

name: Edward Au
comment: the equipments are good, especially for cross fit training. there are also decent number of kettlebells of up to 28kg. would love that they can have a few heavier ones! i am a visitor and it is kind of self-service to buy their day passes via their tablets at the counter. if you do not know spanish, remember to have a translator installed in your phone as it helps. once you registered, and followed their instructions to install an app, then you can use the qr code generated from the app to enter and exit the gym, and use the app to buy additional day passes.

name: Chris Noble-Beeck
comment: while i value the positive aspects of the gym, including the staff's friendliness, the camaraderie among members, and the quality of the classes offered (particularly the boxing club), some significant areas require attention. the facility's limitations, such as the size, the age of the equipment, and the lack of planned renovations, are concerning. furthermore, the absence of enforced gym etiquette, specifically regarding the re-racking of weights, creates a frustrating environment for other members. the trainers' willingness to assist all members is commendable. however, the behavior of certain individuals, who disregard basic gym courtesy, negatively impacts the overall experience. given the high demand for equipment, strategic workout timing and alternative exercises are advisable. the recent acquisition by a competitor and the implementation of a qr code entry system are noted. the ongoing renovations, particularly the repainting of the lower level, are observed. the staff remains consistently pleasant. we trust that the company will consider acquiring new equipment, potentially replacing existing machinery with updated models and introducing essential additions. furthermore, we are experiencing increasing dissatisfaction with the behavior of new gym members who disregard established protocols, such as failing to re-rack weights, which necessitates a corrective action plan. implementing clear rules and consequences for non-compliance is essential. a tiered system of penalties, including a one-day suspension for the first offense, a one-week suspension for the second, and a one-month suspension for the third, culminating in permanent expulsion for a fourth infraction, is recommended. it is imperative to foster a culture of shared responsibility and respect within the gym environment. we urge viva gym to address this issue proactively, as it is unacceptable for patrons to maintain the facility's cleanliness and order more effectively than the staff. regarding recent developments, we have learned that the current manager, who has been instrumental in maintaining the gym's operations despite limited resources, is being transferred to a viva gym location in a less desirable area. this decision is concerning, given her significant contributions to the company. it is recommended that the company recognize her exceptional performance and consider her for a managerial position, rather than appointing an external candidate. the previous management structure included two managers, and the current manager has consistently demonstrated the same level of dedication and effectiveness as her counterpart. moreover, the issue of members failing to re-rack equipment and maintain a civil environment persists, requiring further attention.

name: Pelle Tenten
comment: a great gym. i was looking for a gym to work out at during my stay in madrid. the location is very central and close to my hostel. the staff is super friendly, and i received excellent help right away. i was even allowed to borrow a lock. a…

name: Leonie Leitner
comment: highly recommend // muy recomendable ‍ from my point of view, the best gym in madrid! super fancy design, all the necessary equipment and a huuge range of classes (my favorites being spinning and boxing but also they have great yoga classes ‍) with highly qualified trainers. they do a lot of special events and master classes that are keeping you motivated. all the staff members are super friendly and everything is nice and clean, so you’ll feel totally comfortable. also, a nice plus is that you can pay monthly and don’t have to sign a 2 years contract immediately like in many other gyms.

name: Xana Malhoa
comment: this gym is by far the most complicated to get in. i have been traveling the world for almost 20yrs and always search for gyms with day passes to workout. this one is by far the worst... they ask for all type of info, passport, credit card, bla bla, but then you dont get a notification that you payed and in that way you are not allowed in... crazy system for such an low average gym. the only good thing is that the receptionist was super friendly and helpfull.

name: Jimit Kamdar
comment: mario at reception was really helpful, we were briefly visiting madrid and he guided us the best option possible. good gym and well equipments.

name: Dean Gels
comment: super friendly staff. great atmosphere for a quick work out on our visit to madrid.

name: S D
comment: don’t go unless you want to be greeted by a cockroach during your workout

name: Cosme Valera
comment: good experience overall. however, bathroom stinks. the floor in the free weight is uneven and machines have small roms. if you want to take fitness and weightlifting kind of seriously, it's not the best place to do so. also they close very soon (22:15 in theory) but since 22:00 they are very annoying and they will tell you it's time to close and so on when time is near, even stopping you in the middle of a series.

name: Anas Alzoubi
comment: well decorated gym with good ambient, not really big, equipment are excellent.

name: connorado9
comment: i actually look forward to coming to this gym. the equipment is nice, there’s at least 1 of every machine/radk i use, and day passes are €15.

name: Carlos Martinez
comment: it’s a cool gym, but definitely one of the busiest in the center. no matter the time of day, it’s always packed, now even on fridays and weekends. working out there is getting mad

name: Logan Jackson
comment: this gym has great employees and a lovely interior. i am always motivated to workout thanks to my personal trainer mario, who encourages me to teach my goals and creates a welcoming atmosphere at the gym!

name: Cheri Southwick
comment: great gym with a lot of equipment and cardio machines. the staff is very friendly and helpful. they also have fitness classes. wonderful experience!

name: Jane N
comment: large gym, quiet in the mornings. you can get a day pass for €14.90. some of the equipment was a bit old but still functional. staff could be friendlier.

name: Neabir Jahangir
comment: the gym itself is fine but it’s a scam and they try to charge you for everything. they saw towels are required but won’t provide one and charge for the key and some other stupid fee for signing up. the membership cost is far from the end of the costs. don’t go here if you don’t want to get scammed.

name: Kfir Many
comment: great gym and even better people. they were so nice and helpful and explained everything in the nicest way possible!

name: Darryl Cooper
comment: staff was super helpful. lots of equipment to use. clean.

name: André Schellenberg
comment: badly maintained facilities, i wanted to workout legs, and about 4 machines were out of service. this never happened to me, people at the reception are not flexible at all when you go with someone else’s pass for a single day, they shut their card down. there have already been a lot of complaints about the reception, it’s crazy how bad the service is. wifi doesn’t work at all! not friendly, closes about 30min before the closing time, some machines have been over used, this gym really didn’t exceed my expectations.

name: Joanna Sniadek
comment: equipment is very clean and modern. showers, low pressure+no soap. great mirrors in the changing room. great location. dim lights no squat rack and expensive overall great gym! very happy

name: Yigit O
comment: limited facilities, rather tight and crammed weights area. could be very crowded in the afternoon. aged and tired look almost. staff shortage. expensive for what they offer. it's not bad but not ideal either. there's an empty mezzanine area by the reception. they have to use this area to ease the crammed layout!

name: Emma Wood
comment: since i posted, the management have improved the showers, still taking a while to heat up, but better. as a member nearly two months now, the abysmal showers are what are making me cancel this month. really nice well-equiped gym, but for the price they should splash out on showers that work, are warm, and also on some more hairdryers. and the ceiling leaks that have been there since i started at least. really uncomfortable morning pre-work for that reason.

name: Enrico P
comment: overall good gym. no bad smells, great ventilation. there are enough free weights (but only one bench press station), there’s at least one pull-up bar, and plenty of crossfit-type stations. decently clean locker room. pleasant staff. €14 for a day pass. bring a lock or borrow one (free) at the front desk.

name: Svk Svk
comment: nice gym, friendly and enthusiastic trainers. they were able to offer a month to month membership during our two month stay in madrid. the gym is very centrally located 2 mins from plaza del sol & the metro. we easily walked from a few different neighborhoods during our stay. like a lot of gyms there is plenty equipment during non peak hours, but it gets a little too crowded in the early evenings... when’s it’s hard to get an open bench or hop on the machine you need. but we easily came earlier or later once we figured this out. also taking a spin class during this time wouldn’t be a bad idea. the space offers a weight room with free weights, many machines (a few outstanding ones, i quite liked), a functional training area with two squat racks and bumper plates, a large cardio room, spin room and an upstairs group room. they offer several daily spin classes, zumba, power zumba (on wednesday’s), g-box as well as several others. we actually found the power zumba to be quite fun cardio! the fee worked out to about 60€ per person per month. thank you myst for being a solid workout option during our stay, we will look you back up the next time we are in town!

name: F G
comment: altafit gym je izuzetno opremljen fitness centar s raznolikim i modernim spravama, pružajući izvanredno iskustvo za vježbače svih kondicijskih razina. profesionalno osoblje uvijek je spremno pružiti pomoć i savjete, stvarajući prijateljsku i motivirajuću atmosferu. prostrane svlačionice i čisti prostori doprinose ukupnom dojmu udobnosti i higijene.

name: Alparslan Kaya
comment: worst gym i have ever been. no machine allows you to go full range of motion. squat rack is not stable, i am not even going to talk about bench press…

name: uriel sura
comment: amazing place. the trainers help with everything and the gym is great overall.

name: Nicolas Baudy
comment: on te dit que le prix c'est pour 3 semaines... en fait, non, ça expire au bout de 2... pas cool!! certains font régner un climat désagréable (refus de partager les agréés, échange d'insultes, etc)... et... et... le personnel de la salle qui avoue son impuissance à faire appliquer les règles les plus élémentaires de civisme et de vie en société. vous êtes de passage! vous êtes un étranger! clairement, vous pouvez payer mais vous n'êtes pas les bienvenus, ni pour le personnel, ni pour les habitués,... manifestement! la salle est petite et sans lumière naturelle. bref, tirez-en les conclusions que vous voulez! en tout cas, pour moi, c'est "over"

name: Bigot Anne-Cécile
comment: amazing gym! it is spacious, very clean, with a lot of machines to work out. the classes are really good and the teachers are super nice! i would definitively recommend this gym

name: Tj Engstrom
comment: the only way to get in is to sign up online, but their website does not work and the front desk does nothing to help

name: Omar Gonzales
comment: it looks really good from inside. high level gym, very nice installations. it has everything you need for a proper workout.

name: Полина Кохановская
comment: старые тренажёры, течет вода из потолка ,

name: danessa monsalve
comment: great place to do calisthenics since all the gyms in madrid never have space for this only machines and cardio. the service is really good and everything is super clean all the time.

name: E. Peter McLean
comment: gym facilities for serious training. excellent, well maintained equipment and multiple locations in madrid. spacious training areas that include multiple options for different training routines.

name: Virgili
comment: price is a bit high but facilities are ok. showers aren't as clean as expected. offers wi-fi service but can't use streaming apps like soptify. no phone signal on premises.

name: Margarita Krylova
comment: очень старые тренажеры. мало различных тренажеров. за такую цену ожидала лучшего качества. не кому не буду рекомендовать.

name: Jari Rokko
comment: scammers. my friend bought ticket to alta fit with passport to every gym but was not able to enter. the cashier was "no can do you otta go to malaga to ask them"

name: A Guivel
comment: best gym ever clean... great staff , friendly always there for any questions. especially through this tough time all is good . el mejor

name: RH MB
comment: if you want a place that is really clean, trendy, with nice people, and not overcrowded, then this is your place to be. all classes are also included. plus is in sol, as central as it gets.

name: Iga Lechowicz
comment: i have a membership in other altafit and they didn't let me in for a class because my band is not working. the receptionist said i denied something in the contract which i didn't. very disappointed because i traveled very far for this class.

name: Pottha Koko
comment: i'm a ceaseless client.

name: Roy Moukarzel
comment: nice gym with good offers for 3days/1week acces (useful if you are a visitor to madrid)

name: Kateryna Zlatova
comment: really good gym in sol

name: Ayman Abdel Fattah
comment: nice gym with new equipment, dim lights, clean, spacious and friendly staff!

name: Lan Lê Ngọc
comment: without a doubt

name: Saskia Schneider
comment: pire salle!

name: Daniel Salas
comment: nice and fancy gym! the classes they have are really good

name: Vadim Peretokin
comment: no squat rack, poor ventilation, no soap in showers and the locks aren't digital.

name: Alessandra Folli
comment: accoglienza pessima, sporco e disposizione degli attrezzi decisamente migliorabile.

name: Caroline Masel
comment: super helpful and patient staff!

name: Mikel Asensio
comment: no signal at all, wifi doesn’t work. so much to improve.

name: Alma Silva
comment: issues with personal trainers. don't go here if you expect good service

name: Fabrice Schuffenecker
comment: salle très agréable avec du matériel haut de gamme

name: Lucas Pelt
comment: the staff is not friendly at all. the gym is central and that’s it.

name: GAZZOLA HERNAN
comment: bon gymnase clientèle belle,beaux mecs

name: Andres Thee cardenas
comment: love it , good prices nice people

name: Victor Winston
comment: très bien. matériel cassé à réparer....

name: Marcio Charlye Mello
comment: i liked, for me is very nice!!!

name: Noman Aykilsiz “Volkan aykan”
comment: reception was so rude i am not recommend it

name: Shamraiz Asghar
comment: moy bouno

name: Leticia Solá
comment: small gym, but it has a bit of everything

name: Kati Nikopensius
comment: got very arrogant service in reception.

name: Alana de la Hidalga
comment: great well priced

name: Daiana Ciocan
comment: top

name: alex alex
comment: good

name: Claude Kalisa
comment: matos impeccable

name: Javier Andres Ossorio Hernandez
comment: super bien

name: Christopher Kanda
comment: bonne salle de sport

name: Nicolas De la Borda Mejía
comment: top
